title: Discoteca Anni 90 [Lossy Mp3 VBR] Hits of the 90s - Dance, Dream
description:
DETAILS

Date: 1990-1999
Genre: Dance, Dream, Progressive, Techno, Trance.
Bit rate: Various (128-320 Kbps VBR)
Format: MP3
Size: 1,66 GB
Tagged: Title; Artist; Year; Genre.


DESCRIPTION



SEASON

In the history of dance music, 90 years have been those in which the music industry has invested heavily in the production of disco music. Unlike the eighties, where the general character of the music market was the pop, the 90 are characterized by the presence of massive productions, musical artists and groups devoted explicitly to disco music. During this time you are increasing the record labels that produce only dance music. Just as happened in the 70's with disco music, it comes back to attend a new period of glory of disco music and, due to the predominant feature in this decade, there has been contamination suffered by many artists not normally devoted to this type of music.
Following the success of such primordial house (1986-1989) and its derivatives, the 90 start to operate in the field of dance and fertile ground already explored for new proposals. The first years of the decade 1990 are characterized by increasingly sharp separation of dance genres and, consequently, we are seeing for the first time a differentiation of the clubs based on the type of music they play. In a decisive manner, assume its own identity and character is the kind that the Techno House, which will be gradually to stand at the antipodes. The first is the kind that in the early Nineties will be distinguished by the large number of experiments and resampling of songs of the past, and the type of catchy melodies, but sought not to be confused however with the eurodance music only from that predominate Since 1993, the dance in all its genres is the genre most music played in clubs. Techno music is the protagonist instead of phenomena such as rave parties and clubs of enormous size, which is to dominate the electronic sounds and "aggressive", that is characterized by more distinct bass and a number of beats per minute (BPM) more high in comparison to house music. Transversely, as already introduced above, since 1993 there has been a great success and catchy dance like that in Italy will be called simply dance, eurodance in the rest of Europe (particularly in reference to the German and Belgian productions) and the U.S. House very general. Eurodance music is the dominant genre of the 90's and is still appreciated.


MY SELECTION

What you will find is my personal best-of those years, for most songs will be dance / eurodance, or commonly called "commercial", but there will also be a separate folder where you will find other songs (Dream-Progressive Techno-Trance). Purists in the latter category may turn up their noses, patience ... I tried to do what is just a collection of songs that I have heard and danced at the time, regardless of gender.
Needless to say it was a wonderful time, that those who lived it most likely will regret it ... listening again to some old song and maybe he will get goose bumps thinking about the times we had (at least that's what happens to me).
I wish to all a good listen and a good journey through the memories to someone.

PERIODO

Nella storia della musica dance, gli anni 90 sono stati quelli in cui l'industria discografica ha investito maggiormente nelle produzioni di musica da discoteca. A differenza degli anni ottanta, dove il genere protagonista del mercato discografico era il pop, gli anni 90 sono caratterizzati da un'imponente presenza di produzioni, artisti e gruppi musicali dediti esplicitamente alla musica da discoteca. In questo periodo si vanno moltiplicando le etichette discografiche che producono solo musica dance. Proprio come accadde negli anni 70 con la disco-music, si torna ad assistere ad un nuovo periodo di gloria della musica da discoteca e, caratteristica riconducibile in modo predominante a questo decennio, si registra la contaminazione subita da molti artisti normalmente non dediti a questo tipo di musica.
